<li><a href="https://easydigitaldownloads.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Easy Digital Downloads</a> – The best WordPress eCommerce plugin to sell digital products (eBooks, software, music, and more).</li>
<li><a href="https://sugarcalendar.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Sugar Calendar</a> – A simple event calendar plugin for WordPress that&#8217;s both easy and powerful.</li>
<li><a href="https://www.wpcharitable.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">WPCharitable</a> – Top-rated WordPress donation and fundraising plugin for WordPress.</li>
</ul>
<p>Visit <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/" title="WPBeginner" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPBeginner</a> to learn from our <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/category/wp-tutorials/" title="WordPress Tutorials" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WordPress Tutorials</a> and find out about other <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/category/plugins/" title="Best WordPress Plugins" rel="friend nofollow ugc">best WordPress plugins</a>.</p>
<h3>Notes</h3>
<p>WPForms is absolutely, positively the most <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="Best WordPress contact form plugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">beginner friendly WordPress contact form plugin</a> on the market. It is both easy and powerful.</p>
<p>We took the pain out of creating online forms and made it easy. Check out all <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPForms features</a>.</p>
<p>Also, I&#8217;m the founder of <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPBeginner</a>, the largest WordPress resource site for beginners. It was a huge priority for me to make a WordPress contact form plugin that beginners can use without any training.</p>
<p>I feel that we have done that here. I hope you enjoy using WPForms.</p>
<p>Thank you</p>
<p>Syed Balkhi</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:739:"<ol>
<li>Install WPForms Lite either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend nofollow ugc">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate WPForms Lite.</li>
<li>Navigate to the WPForms tab at the bottom of your admin menu and click the &#8220;Add New&#8221; button to begin creating your new WordPress contact form.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Purchase the full version of WPForms</a>!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:9104:"
<dt id='who%20should%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Who should use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms is perfect for business owners, bloggers, designers, developers, photographers, and basically everyone else. If you want to create a custom WordPress form, then you need to use the WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder.</p>
</p>
<dt id='do%20i%20need%20to%20have%20coding%20skills%20to%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Do I need to have coding skills to use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Absolutely not. You can create and manage forms without any coding knowledge (100% drag &amp; drop form builder). WPForms is the most beginner friendly contact form plugin on the market.</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%20type%20of%20wordpress%20forms%20can%20i%20build%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
What type of WordPress forms can I build with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder combined with our addons is the most powerful WordPress contact form plugin on the market. Here are some types of WordPress forms you can create:</p>
<ul>
<li>Simple Contact Forms</li>
<li>Job Application Contact Form</li>
<li>Feedback Survey Contact Form</li>
<li>Make a Suggestion Contact Form</li>
<li>Change Request Forms</li>
<li>Online Booking Forms</li>
<li>Event Booking Form</li>
<li>Video Release Forms</li>
<li>PTO Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Maintenance Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Scholarship Application Forms</li>
<li>File Download Forms</li>
<li>Employment Verification Forms</li>
<li>Make a Referral Contact Form</li>
<li>Volunteer Registration Contact Form</li>
<li>Offline Contact Form</li>
</ul>
<p>To see a full list, visit our <a href="https://wpforms.com/templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Template Gallery</a> which has over 150+ pre-made contact form templates.</p>
</p>
<dt id='which%20form%20fields%20does%20wpforms%20offer%3F'>
Which Form Fields Does WPForms offer?
</h4>
<p>
<p>We made WPForms form builder to be both easy and powerful.</p>
<p>Here are the contact form fields that comes with WPForms Form Builder (also known as Standard Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Text Field</li>
<li>Paragraph Text (Textarea)</li>
<li>Dropdown Field</li>
<li>Multiple Choice (Radio Buttons)</li>
<li>Checkboxes</li>
<li>Numbers Field</li>
<li>Name Field</li>
<li>Email Address Field</li>
<li>Number Slider Field</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our advanced contact form builder fields (Fancy Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Smart Phone Field with international format verification</li>
<li>Address Field</li>
<li>Date / Time Field</li>
<li>Website / URL Field</li>
<li>File Upload &#8211; Great for File Upload Form</li>
<li>Password Field</li>
<li>Rich Text &#8211; Add a WYSIWYG field, perfect for guest blog post forms</li>
<li>Layout Field – Position form fields inside columns using custom or pre-made layouts</li>
<li>Page Break Field &#8211; Great for Multi Page Contact Form with Progress Bar</li>
<li>Section Divider &#8211; Great for Long Contact Forms</li>
<li>HTML Field &#8211; add Custom HTML inside your form</li>
<li>Content Field &#8211; Add headings, lists, and media to your forms without writing code</li>
<li>Entry Preview &#8211; Allow your form users to preview their form entries before they&#8217;ve submitted them</li>
<li>Star Rating &#8211; Great for Survey Forms and Polls</li>
<li>Hidden Field</li>
<li>Questions CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Math CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Likert Scale &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Signature Field &#8211; Great for Contracts and Booking Forms</li>
<li>Net Promoter Score (NPS Field) &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Google ReCAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>hCAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Cloudflare Turnstile &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our Payment Fields that will help you create a order form, donation form, booking form, and other payment forms:</p>
<ul>
<li>Single Item</li>
<li>Multiple Items</li>
<li>Checkbox Items</li>
<li>Dropdown Items</li>
<li>Total (Calculation Field)</li>
<li>Credit Card (Stripe, Square, and Authorize.Net)</li>
<li>PayPal</li>
</ul>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20integrate%20wpforms%20with%20my%20crm%20or%20email%20marketing%20service%3F'>
Can I integrate WPForms with my CRM or Email Marketing Service?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms offers seamless integration with over 1,000+ popular <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-email-marketing-services/" rel="nofollow ugc">email marketing</a> and <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-crm-software-for-small-businesses-compared/" rel="nofollow ugc">CRM software</a>.</p>
<p>You can easily send data from your contact form and other WordPress forms to your favorite CRM, email newsletter, and other marketing platforms.</p>
<p>Here is a list of our popular marketing integrations:</p>
<ul>
<li>Mailchimp</li>
<li>Constant Contact</li>
<li>AWeber</li>
<li>Drip</li>
<li>Campaign Monitor</li>
<li>GetResponse</li>
<li>ActiveCampaign</li>
<li>Zapier</li>
<li>Salesforce CRM</li>
<li>Sendinblue</li>
<li>MailerLite</li>
</ul>
<p>Using our Zapier integration, you can easily connect WPForms with over 5,000+ marketing apps including:</p>
<ul>
<li>PipeDrive CRM</li>
<li>Google Sheets</li>
<li>Active Campaign</li>
<li>Zoho CRM</li>
<li>Zoho Mail</li>
<li>Zoho Invoice</li>
<li>Agile CRM</li>
<li>Slack</li>
<li>Trello</li>
<li>Infusionsoft by Keap</li>
<li>Microsoft Excel</li>
<li>Dropbox</li>
<li>HelpScout</li>
<li>Zendesk</li>
<li>Freshbooks</li>
<li>Freshsales</li>
<li>Intercom</li>
<li>Click Funnels</li>
<li>Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM</li>
<li>Capsule CRM</li>
<li>Insightly CRM</li>
<li>Printfection</li>
<li>Acuity Scheduling</li>
<li>Quickbooks Online</li>
</ul>
<p>See all <a href="https://zapier.com/apps/wpforms/integrations" rel="nofollow ugc">WPForms Zapier Integrations</a>.</p>
<p>Note: WPForms was voted Zapier&#8217;s 6th fastest growing app in the world.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20create%20a%20payment%20form%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
Can I create a Payment Form with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms is not your average contact form plugin. You can use it to create any type of form including payment forms.</p>
<p>We make it easy for you to accept payments using Stripe, Authorize.Net, and PayPal.</p>
<p>Both our Stripe and Authorize.Net integrations helps you easily accept credit card payments online.</p>
<p>Our PayPal integration allows you to accept PayPal payments online.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20import%20%2F%20export%20forms%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
Can I Import / Export Forms with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms makes it easy to import / export your contact forms and other WordPress forms created with WPForms form builder. This is incredibly useful for developers and agencies who are building websites for clients.</p>
<p>You can also create custom form templates that you can use on client websites. For more see our documentation.</p>
<p>Aside from that, WPForms also allows you to import forms from other WordPress Contact Form plugins such as Contact Form 7, Ninja Forms, and Pirate Forms.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re not happy with your WordPress contact form plugin, then definitely give WPForms a try!</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%27d%20like%20access%20to%20all%20features.%20how%20can%20i%20get%20them%3F'>
I&#8217;d like access to all features. How can I get them?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get access to more features, addons and support by <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="Click here to learn more about WPForms!" rel="friend nofollow ugc">upgrading to our Pro version</a>. Purchasing a Pro license gets you access to the full version of WPForms, automatic updates, priority support, and all WPForms Addons!</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20wpforms%20translation%20ready%3F'>
Is WPForms translation ready?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms has full translation and localization support via the wpforms textdomain. Based on your site language, required .mo and .po translation files will be downloaded and placed into the default WordPress languages directory. The same is true for every WPForms Addon as well.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20wpforms%20include%20spam%20protection%3F'>
Does WPForms include spam protection?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms includes spam protection which is enabled on all forms by default in the form settings.</p>
<p>Additionally, Google reCAPTCHA, hCaptcha and Cloudflare Turnstile are also supported and can be set up at WPForms &gt; Settings &gt; CAPTCHA.</p>
<p>WPForms is fully compatible with all versions of Google reCAPTCHA:</p>
<ul>
<li>Checkbox reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>Invisible reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>reCAPTCHA v3</li>
</ul>
<p>Lastly, <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/custom-catpcha-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Custom Captchas</a> are available which allow you to create math or question based captchas for your contact forms.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:21964:"<h4>1.8.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Admin notice content and design is improved.</li>
<li>Changed: We optimized the Help screen performance within the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: The query string rewrite module from the 7G Firewall plugin was conflicting with the WPForms block in the Block Editor.</li>
<li>Fixed: Payment fields were not inheriting a newly updated currency from the WPForms Settings &gt; Payments page.</li>
<li>Fixed: When duplicating a field in the Form Builder, the options panel for the newly duplicated field was not consistently active.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms admin area was using a site language instead of the currently logged-in user language if languages were different.</li>
<li>Fixed: When an email field contained long words without spaces, words were not properly wrapped.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form settings were not reflecting new template settings when switching those templates.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge pointers were overlapping text labels in some languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: In some cases, the page with a form on the front end was not scrolled to the error field.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Dropdown border width was wrong when the input was smaller than the dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: It was possible to resize the Paragraph field larger than the containers.</li>
<li>Fixed: Empty option was replaced with the default one for a duplicated dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: There was a fatal error on the Analytics page if the MonsterInsights Lite plugin was active.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Location title and slug were incorrect after updating a post with that form embedded.</li>
<li>Fixed: The &#8220;From Email&#8221; option validation message was invisible when the WP Mail SMTP plugin was active.</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP warning &#8216;Illegal string offset&#8217; appeared on some sites.</li>
<li>Fixed: Placeholder text in the Dynamic choices of the Dropdown field was not displayed when the field was duplicated.</li>
<li>Fixed: The &#8220;Let&#8217;s Go!&#8221; button inside the Form Embed screen was disabled after the page title change.</li>
<li>Fixed: Bulk option labels were not inline in some languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some field titles were broken in Safari in the Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Developers can now use a new hook that is fired when the form is duplicated.</li>
<li>Fixed: A PHP deprecation notice was generated when enabling or disabling auto-updates of any plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form challenge items were not aligned correctly in various languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Legacy Layout Classes didn&#8217;t work when using the Modern Form Styles.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom Math Captcha was still large when the Lead Forms addon was disabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Checkboxes and Multiple Choice fields with icons were cut on mobile devices.</li>
<li>Fixed: Words in the Form Export dropdown on the Tools &gt; Export admin page were split by letters.</li>
<li>Fixed: Links were stripped in choices labels.</li>
<li>Fixed: Block Editor kept showing the unsaved changes dialog even though there weren&#8217;t any changes.</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>wpforms_sanitize_amount()</code> function did not work properly with exponent numbers.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with the Popup Maker plugin was improved &#8211; Stripe Credit Card field didn&#8217;t load when a payment form was inserted into a popup.</li>
<li>Fixed: There was no empty state when no forms created for the WPForms widget in the Elementor screen.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Payment fields are now available for everyone.</li>
<li>Added: Users can connect their Stripe accounts and receive payments via their payment forms.</li>
<li>Added: There are new thumbnails displayed in all places where you see the list of available form templates (Form Builder and Form Templates page).</li>
<li>Added: Plugin cache files are handled in a more performant way.</li>
<li>Changed: An outdated version of the Moment.js library was removed from the plugin, and we switched to using the one bundled in WordPress.</li>
<li>Changed: Preview labels for choices with HTML tags were improved.</li>
<li>Fixed: There were situations when the <code>{user_ip}</code> smart tag was returning a server IP address instead of the actual user&#8217;s IP address.</li>
<li>Fixed: An unnecessary database query was run on all admin dashboard pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Modern Multiple Dropdown couldn&#8217;t be closed by clicking on the arrow.</li>
<li>Fixed: The &#8220;Save&#8221; button wasn&#8217;t fully clickable on the WPForms &gt; Settings admin page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some UI elements didn&#8217;t look correctly on the Form Builder page for non-English languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some fields were non-responsive on mobile when using the Legacy Layout Classes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Cron event <code>wpforms_email_summaries_cron</code> was not removed upon plugin deactivation.</li>
<li>Fixed: It was possible to add disabled fields to the form again in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: The form was not displayed on the front end when the WPForms block was added to block templates.</li>
<li>Fixed: On the Payments page for Stripe payments &#8220;N/A&#8221; was displayed as a payment title instead of the mapped email.</li>
<li>Fixed: There were situations when PHP notices were generated on the Stripe Single Payment page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with the &#8220;AIOSEO &#8211; Local Business&#8221; plugin was improved.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: The Uncanny Automator logo is updated.</li>
<li>Fixed: Debug information (controlled by a constant) is now properly escaped before being displayed on a page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Turnstile Captcha verification message overlapped the captcha when the captcha type was changed from Invisible to Managed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fatal error with AMP plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Checkboxes were shifting when the limit choices rule was triggered.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Ask for a review&#8221; admin notice links improperly opened new tab.</li>
<li>Fixed: There was a fatal error when settings were incorrectly reset by a 3rd-party plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Modern Form Styles &#8211; easily control the appearance of form fields, labels, and buttons without writing code, right inside the Block Editor.</li>
<li>Added: The new filter <code>wpforms_frontend_assets_header_force_load</code> allows forcing load assets in the header which is useful when the form is in the sidebar widget and similar locations.</li>
<li>Changed: Tooltips design is improved.</li>
<li>Fixed: The form preview page was incorrectly shown in some themes.</li>
<li>Fixed: CF turnstile form ID was translated creating problems with analysis in Cloudflare Dashboard.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notifications Settings styles were looking bad on a small screen in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: An &#8220;active column&#8221; state was stuck for a duplicated Layout field inside the Form Builder preview panel.</li>
<li>Fixed: Limit Length functionality was broken in the Paragraph Text field.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify library to 3.0.1.</li>
<li>Fixed: An error occurred when the DreamHost Panel Login plugin and WPForms Lite were both active and WPForms Pro was activated.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form template block in the Form Builder could overflow the container on smaller screen sizes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Long links in the HTML email messages did not wrap and caused overflow issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Google reCAPTCHA v2 could not be reset on server-side validation failure.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Prevent spam submissions using the new Cloudflare Turnstile anti-spam integration. You can find it on the Settings &gt; CAPTCHA page.</li>
<li>Changed: Non-public taxonomies should not be displayed in Dynamic Choices&#8217; available sources.</li>
<li>Changed: External usage of removed PHP classes is now handled gracefully without generating fatal errors.</li>
<li>Changed: The performance of the Email field validation is improved when using an allowlist or denylist.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify library to 2.4.3.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Dropdown field text indentation was incorrect in the Form Builder in Firefox.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various notification modals&#8217; titles had inconsistent sizes in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Validation errors in various modals were inconsistent in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: When duplicating an inactive field, the settings of the active field are now removed properly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some cache files were unnecessarily re-downloaded on the front end.</li>
<li>Fixed: Users with roles other than Administrator could not add the reCAPTCHA/hCaptcha field and dismiss notices even if they had sufficient permissions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Number Slider field validation failed if a maximum value was not a multiple of steps..</li>
<li>Fixed: HTML markup in the Default Text of Paragraph Text fields was not being displayed on the front end and in the Form Builder preview.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.9.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect spacing around the Submit button in the Form Builder was fixed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing assets were added to the plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Icon Choices feature for Checkboxes and Multiple Choice fields &#8211; a selection of 2000+ icons can now be used with your choices!</li>
<li>Changed: Avoid rendering the WPForms Import admin page if the user lacks <code>unfiltered_html</code> capability.</li>
<li>Changed: Respect site settings for displaying avatars on the Revisions screen in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Changed: Color picker fields in the Form Builder are now correctly handling default colors.</li>
<li>Changed: In the form Notifications you can now set up the Reply-To Name value in addition to the Reply-To Email using a special format.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated jquery-confirm library to 3.3.4.</li>
<li>Fixed: Prevent field duplication in the Form Builder performed multiple times when clicking fast inside the confirmation modal.</li>
<li>Fixed: Action links were rendered on two lines in the admin dashboard widget.</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notices were generated when form locations logic ran for unregistered post types.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Embed modal performance in the Form Builder was improved a lot when there are a ton of pages on a site.</li>
<li>Fixed: The confirmation message for non-AJAX form submissions wasn&#8217;t wrapped into the main form container.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improved compatibility with Elementor popups v3.9+.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notification email suggestion didn&#8217;t work properly in WordPress installed in a subdomain.</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>{page_title}</code> smart tag was conflicting with the wpSEO plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Better compatibility with the Popup Maker plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: All anti-spam protection settings are grouped in one place in the Form Builder &gt; Settings for easier access.</li>
<li>Changed: Recently added Form Templates are now available in the &#8220;New Templates&#8221; category.</li>
<li>Changed: Non-responsive (desktop) version of the Form Builder is not accessible on mobile devices.</li>
<li>Fixed: jQuery deprecation notices were triggered in the browser&#8217;s console.</li>
<li>Fixed: Close button in dropdowns was displayed incorrectly in certain places.</li>
<li>Fixed: A PHP warning was raised on certain site configurations when the user tried to submit a form.</li>
<li>Fixed: Toggle control animation was working incorrectly in certain cases.</li>
<li>Fixed: Text was overlapping the down arrow on dropdowns in the 2021 theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge user experience was improved.</li>
<li>Fixed: Smart tag list was too big in fields with warnings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some input masks caused the text in the Text field to be right-aligned.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with the 2023 theme was improved.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.7.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: There is a new filter <code>wpforms_builder_panel_sidebar_section_classes</code> to change builder panel sidebar section classes.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify library to 2.4.0.</li>
<li>Fixed: Placeholder text in the Dropdown field was cut off in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Form Builder had an inconsistent text strings escaping.</li>
<li>Fixed: The information about &#8220;no form templates to display&#8221; did not disappear when a category was changed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Very long field labels were not wrapped and were breaking mid-word.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: All templates are now available on our new Form Templates admin page.</li>
<li>Added: Form Templates can now be marked as favorite for easier access to forms inside the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Added: The form fields column can now be collapsed in the Form Builder to give more space to the form preview panel.</li>
<li>Changed: The DB tables row in the Site Health Info section is now private which means it&#8217;s excluded from the copied data when the &#8220;Copy site info to clipboard&#8221; button is clicked.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge was displayed after a forms search with no result.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge disappeared after selecting a template for the new form.</li>
<li>Fixed: After a form submission a PHP warning was generated in some cases when the Akismet anti-spam protection setting was enabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Using allow/deny list was breaking input mask validation for all fields above the Email field.</li>
<li>Fixed: An unusually long text string in the confirmation message caused layout problems due to overflow.</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>page_title</code> smart tag was working inconsistently on a form preview page.</li>
<li>Fixed: From Email address check in the Form Builder &gt; Notifications was incorrectly handling domain check containing the <code>www</code> prefix.</li>
<li>Fixed: Input mask validation message didn&#8217;t use what was previously saved on the WPForms &gt; Settings &gt; Validation page.</li>
<li>Fixed: On the Form builder, a template selection didn&#8217;t work if a page was translated through web extensions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Form Submissions can now be checked against the Akismet API to prevent spam.</li>
<li>Changed: Empty post titles and term names in Dynamic Choices are now treated the way WordPress does.</li>
<li>Changed: Modern Dropdown field fuzzy search sensitivity is adjusted to display only exact matches.</li>
<li>Changed: Allow typing choices in the modern Dropdown field with the Multiple Options Selection option enabled.</li>
<li>Changed: WPForms Challenge experience is improved for new users.</li>
<li>Changed: Lite Connect is now disabled in non-production environments.</li>
<li>Changed: Lite Connect functionality improves handling of staging and cloned sites, and changed domain names.</li>
<li>Changed: Unnecessary PHP packages are no longer shipped in WPForms Lite.</li>
<li>Changed: Stylesheets loaded in the Form Builder and on certain plugin pages are better optimized and shrank to improve performance.</li>
<li>Changed: WPForms now better integrates with the WP Mail SMTP plugin to enable overriding From Name and From Email values in existing forms.</li>
<li>Changed: Form Notifications now have better validation of From Email settings.</li>
<li>Changed: Start using new <code>elementor/widgets/register</code> hook introduced in Elementor 3.5.0.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify library to 2.3.10.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated jquery.validate library to 1.19.5.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improved compatibility with Twenty Twenty-Two theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: Added meaningful <code>alt</code> text to form submission spinner image to stop being flagged by certain SEO scanners.</li>
<li>Fixed: Constant Contact Authorization Code and Account Nickname fields are now required on the Settings &gt; Integrations page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Constant Contact connection can now be added even if the Authorization Code is invalid.</li>
<li>Fixed: Validation of required fields on Marketing section in the Form Builder was triggered even if the field is hidden.</li>
<li>Fixed: Action Scheduler was triggering a PHP fatal error on the Tools &gt; Scheduled Actions page on PHP 5.6.</li>
<li>Fixed: Images breaking out of containers on smaller screens if Multiple Choice and Checkboxes fields were set to use image choices.</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>query_var</code> smart tag was not working in Confirmations and Notifications.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom templates had an incorrect badge, &#8220;Addon&#8221; instead of &#8220;Custom&#8221;.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Confirmation Message label overlapped the editor when WYSIWYG mode was disabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Default form title was not changed when switching form templates.</li>
<li>Fixed: Both <code>page_title</code> and <code>page_id</code> smart tags were returning incorrect values on non-singular pages if the form was used outside the Loop.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Block preview (on block hover) was rendered incorrectly in Site Editor.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom validation errors were not displayed with hCaptcha enabled upon AJAX form submission.</li>
<li>Fixed: Validation errors were not shown when the field with an input mask was not fully filled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Smart Tags could be added to Sender Email and Sender Name if the fields were managed by the WP Mail SMTP plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Confirmation message block had incorrect margins in the Twenty Twenty-Two theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: Occasional errors during migration were fixed when upgrading from some older versions of WPForms.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Confirmation Redirect URL can no longer be saved with an empty value.</li>
<li>Fixed: Default choices were displayed on the frontend if a Dynamic Choices source had no objects (Dropdown, Multiple Choice, and Checkboxes fields were affected).</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.5.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Migrations logic was broken in certain cases when addons have their own migrations.</li>
<li>Fixed: Security-related improvements around email generation for notifications.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.5.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: New filter to modify CSS classes of the form submit button on the frontend.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve cached templates handling in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Retrieving a current URL should not strip a custom port.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;JavaScript file not found&#8221; error when the &#8220;Load Assets Globally&#8221; option was enabled in Settings &gt; General.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not cache an incorrect or empty response from the Templates API.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.5.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Increase chances for the templates inside the Form Builder to load properly, so occasional empty form creation from a template should be gone.</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP fatal error was generated in some cases when Lite Connect attempted to generate site key too many times.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.5.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: v1.7.5 migration did not complete when a database prefix other than <code>wp_</code> was used.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect Form Tags links to filter by tags were generated right after saving tags.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Form Tags: add tags to forms with an ability to filter by them; bulk add/edit/delete tags for multiple forms.</li>
<li>Added: Display the status of the Lite Connect setting and the date-time when it was enabled (Tools &gt; System Info).</li>
<li>Added: New <code>{unique_value}</code> smart tag.</li>
<li>Changed: The sodium library is now included in WordPress core, so we removed it from the plugin.</li>
<li>Changed: Action Scheduler library was updated to 3.4.2 to fix deprecation notices with PHP 8.1.</li>
<li>Changed: The jquery.validate library updated to 1.19.4.</li>
<li>Changed: Conditional logic can now be applied to custom fields.</li>
<li>Changed: Do not allow not completed Challenge to appear in the regular Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: For some fields, their default values were not always previewed in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Regularly clean up additional information we store for each task we run within the plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: No fatal error anymore in Allow/Deny email lists with very long or international emails.</li>
<li>Fixed: Correctly handle additional CSS classes for each WPForms block on the same page (Block Editor).</li>
<li>Fixed: Modals order was incorrect when the Lite Connect feature was enabled or disabled on mobile.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notification for the last step of the WPForms Challenge was not displayed on the Posts Page with the Gutenberg plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some Form Templates could be empty upon fresh installation.</li>
<li>Fixed: Several minor issues in the Challenge flow are now fixed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Color Palette was not shown in the Form Builder for duplicated fields.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not register Gutenberg block styles on the front end when no form is present on a page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Limit the number of attempts to get the site key in Lite Connect.</li>
<li>Fixed: Multiple Items (Radio) choice showed &#8220;Empty&#8221; on a single entry page if a selected choice value is undefined/empty.</li>
<li>Fixed: Added focus state indication for admin tabs.</li>
<li>Fixed: GDPR sub-settings remained enabled if GDPR is disabled and sub-setting was left enabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Duplicate/Trash form actions did not work after sorting forms by Name, Author, or Created Date.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notices appeared in the debug.log when the user created a Custom Template and used it in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: hCaptcha pointer had a weird thick dark border since WordPress 6.0.</li>
<li>Fixed: Check GDPR settings before trying to use a cookie.</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/wpforms-lite/trunk/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc">See changelog for all versions</a>.</p>

&#8211; Maintenance Mode, Coming Soon and Landing Page Builder";s:4:"slug";s:19:"wp-maintenance-mode";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.6.8";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="https://themeisle.com/">Themeisle</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/themeisle/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"6.2.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:16:"requires_plugins";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:611;i:4;i:34;i:3;i:26;i:2;i:15;i:1;i:84;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:770;s:15:"support_threads";i:3;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:14925508;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2023-06-07 7:16am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-02-26";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2932:"<p>Add a maintenance page to your blog that lets visitors know your blog is down for maintenance, add a coming soon page for a new website or create a landing page for an existing site. User with admin rights gets full access to the blog including the front end.</p>
<p>Activate the plugin and your blog is in maintenance-mode, works and only registered users with enough rights can see the front end. You can use a date with a countdown timer for visitor information or set a value and unit for information.</p>
<p>Also works with WordPress Multisite installs (each blog from the network has its own maintenance settings).</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully customizable (change colors, texts and backgrounds).</li>
<li>Subscription form (export emails to .csv file).</li>
<li>Countdown timer (remaining time).</li>
<li>Contact form (receive emails from visitors).</li>
<li>Coming soon page;</li>
<li>Landing page templates;</li>
<li>WordPress multisite;</li>
<li>Responsive design;</li>
<li>Social media icons;</li>
<li>Works with any WordPress theme;</li>
<li>SEO options;</li>
<li>Exclude URLs from maintenance;</li>
<li>Bot functionality to collect the emails in a friendly and efficient way;</li>
<li>GDPR Ready;</li>
</ul>
<h4>Bugs, technical hints or contribute</h4>
<p>Please give us feedback, contribute and file technical bugs on <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode" rel="nofollow ugc">GitHub Repo</a>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<p>Developed by <a href="https://themeisle.com" rel="nofollow ugc">Themeisle</a></p>

</ul>

";s:12:"installation";s:362:"<ol>
<li>Unpack the download package</li>
<li>Upload all files to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory, include folders</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to <code>Settings</code> page, where you can change what settings you need (pay attention to <strong>Exclude</strong> option!)</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:834:"
<dt id='how%20to%20use%20plugin%20filters'>
How to use plugin filters
</h4>
<p>
<p>Check out our <a href="https://github.com/codeinwp/Snippet-Library/" rel="nofollow ugc">Snippet Library</a>.</p>
</p>
<dt id='cache%20plugin%20support'>
Cache Plugin Support
</h4>
<p>
<p>WP Maintenance Mode can be unstable due to the cache plugins; we recommend deactivating any cache plugin when maintenance mode is active. If you <strong>really</strong> want to use a cache plugin, make sure you delete the entire cache after each change.</p>
</p>
<dt id='exclude%20list'>
Exclude list
</h4>
<p>
<p>If you change your login url, please add the new slug (url: http://domain.com/newlogin, then you should add: newlogin) to Exclude list from plugin settings -&gt; General Tab.</p>
<p>Notice: <code>wp-cron.php</code> is excluded by default.</p>
</p>

<p>Update dependencies</p>
<p><a href="https://github.com/Codeinwp/wp-maintenance-mode/compare/v2.4.2...v2.4.3" rel="nofollow ugc">Version 2.4.3</a> (2022-01-27)</p>
<ul>
<li>Change ownership to Themeisle</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.2 (18/01/2022)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Misc: 900 000 Active Installs Celebrations!</li>
<li>Misc: WordPress 5.9 compatibility</li>
<li>Fix: jQuery UI CSS theme reference from jQuery CDN</li>
<li>Misc: Text fixes in the dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.1 (20/07/2021)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Misc: WordPress 5.8 compatibility</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.0 (13/05/2021)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Design: add &#8220;Custom CSS&#8221; setting; Finally! 🙂</li>
<li>Design: add &#8220;Footer links&#8221; color setting</li>
<li>Design: add a list of available shortcodes under the &#8220;Text&#8221; editor</li>
<li>Bot: make {visitor_name} placeholder work in all messages after the visitor types his name</li>
<li>Misc: add [embed] shortcode for responsive video embeds; Compatible with YouTube, Vimeo, DailyMotion.</li>
<li>Misc: make the exclude mechanism work with Cyrillic characters</li>
<li>Misc: add <code>wpmm_maintenance_template</code> filter; It works the same way as the <code>wpmm_contact_template</code> filter, but for the maintenance template.</li>
<li>Misc: now you can override the <code>contact</code> email template too; Check <code>/views/contact.php</code> for more details.</li>
<li>Misc: better compatibility with translation plugins like Loco Translate</li>
<li>Misc: the image uploaders (from the dashboard) are now translatable</li>
<li>Misc: improve uninstall routine</li>
<li>Misc: add <code>wpmm_delete_cache</code> action; It is called after each setting change.</li>
<li>Misc: add support for cache plugins like WP Rocket, WP Fastest Cache, Endurance Page Cache, Swift Performance Lite, Cache Enabler, SG Optimizer, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Helper;</li>
<li>Misc: remove <code>wpmm_count_where</code> helper function</li>
<li>Misc: code improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.0 (07/12/2020)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Modules: add support for Google Analytics 4 measurement ID</li>
<li>Design: enable media buttons on wp_editor (now you can add images from the editor)</li>
<li>Bot: fix translation issue</li>
<li>Misc: add filters for capabilities <code>wpmm_settings_capability</code>, <code>wpmm_subscribers_capability</code>, and <code>wpmm_all_actions_capability</code> (the last one can be used to override all capabilities)</li>
<li>Misc: fix [loginform] shortcode redirect attribute</li>
<li>Misc: a few CSS &amp; Javascript improvements</li>
<li>Misc: bump &#8220;Tested up to&#8221; version to 5.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.4 (20/05/2019)</h4>
<ul>
<li>bump &#8220;Tested up to&#8221; to 5.2.0</li>
<li>fix typo in Italian translation (it_IT)</li>
<li>Bot: add a note about how you can export the list of subscribers <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode/issues/195" rel="nofollow ugc">#195</a></li>
<li>Bot: add client-side sanitization to the input fields <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode/issues/176" rel="nofollow ugc">#176</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.3 (20/02/2019)</h4>
<ul>
<li>bump &#8220;Tested up to&#8221; version to 5.1.0</li>
<li>replace &#8220;wpmu_new_blog&#8221; action with &#8220;wp_initialize_site&#8221; action for WP 5.1.0 users because the first one is deprecated in the new version</li>
<li>small improvement to &#8220;check_exclude&#8221; method from &#8220;WP_Maintenance_Mode&#8221; class</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.2 (27/11/2018)</h4>
<ul>
<li>Google Analytics module: migrate from analytics.js to gtag.js + add ip anonymization <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode/issues/178" rel="nofollow ugc">#178</a></li>
<li>GDPR module: accept links inside texareas + add policy link target <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode/issues/188" rel="nofollow ugc">#188</a></li>
<li>add charset meta tag <a href="https://github.com/andrianvaleanu/WP-Maintenance-Mode/issues/200" rel="nofollow ugc">#200</a></li>
<li>fix PHP Notice:  Undefined index: HTTP_USER_AGENT</li>
<li>add plural and single form translation for subscribers number (settings page)</li>
</ul>
<h4>Earlier versions</h4>
<p>For the changelog of earlier versions, please refer to the <a href="https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/wp-maintenance-mode/trunk/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc">full changelog</a>.</p>

ip";s:5:"2.0.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.0.zip";s:5:"2.0.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.1.zip";s:5:"2.0.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.2.zip";s:5:"2.0.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.4.zip";s:5:"2.0.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.5.zip";s:5:"2.0.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.6.zip";s:5:"2.0.7";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.7.zip";s:5:"2.0.8";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.8.zip";s:5:"2.0.9";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.0.9.zip";s:5:"2.1.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.1.0.zip";s:5:"2.1.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.1.1.zip";s:5:"2.1.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.1.2.zip";s:3:"2.2";s:66:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.2.3.zip";s:5:"2.2.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.3.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.3.0.zip";s:5:"2.4.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.4.0.zip";s:5:"2.4.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.4.1.zip";s:5:"2.4.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.4.2.zip";s:5:"2.4.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-maintenance-mode.2.4.3.zip";s:5:"2.4.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-main Feed – WooCommerce Product Feed Manager Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:38:"webappick-product-feed-for-woocommerce";s:7:"version";s:6:"5.4.33";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="https://webappick.com/">WebAppick</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/wahid0003/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.4";s:6:"tested";s:5:"6.2.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:16:"requires_plugins";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:493;i:4;i:18;i:3;i:11;i:2;i:13;i:1;i:40;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:575;s:15:"support_threads";i:33;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:26;s:10:"downloaded";i:3878174;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2023-07-31 4:53am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-02-10";s:8:"homepage";s:22:"https://webappick.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:53109:"<p>Easily create the most optimized and error-free Google Shopping Product Feed or Google Merchant Feed, Facebook Catalog Feed, Pinterest Shopping Feed, InstagramCatalog Feed, TikTok Catalog, Snapchat Catalog, eBay Ads, Bing Ads, PriceRunner, Rakuten, PriceSpy, Kelko, &amp; 100+ more channels for your WooCommerce Store.</p>
<p>This <strong>WooCommerce product feed Manager Plugin</strong> supports over 100+ recognized channels. Hence, you can reach out to any marketplaces, search engines, affiliate sites, or price comparison sites to extensively promote your products to the customers.</p>
<p>Creating a WooCommerce product feed using CTX Feed – a WooCommerce Product Feed Manager Plugin – has become easier than ever. Struggle no more in creating the most perfect and subtle product feed for your designated and preferred marketing channels for internationally prominent marketplaces, along with other notable ones as well.</p>
<p>It aims to reduce your hardship on marketing efforts to create product feeds and distribute them in multiple marketing/shopping channels. There are flexible options to update product information according to your given schedule and sync the update to the right channel via HTTP or FTP/SFTP. Stay at ease knowing that your customers will automatically get the latest product information.</p>
<h3>WooCommerce Google Shopping Product Feed &#8211; Video Tutorial</h3>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class="youtube-player" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QRTvrDJm4mI?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent" allowfullscreen="true" style="border:0;" sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation"></iframe></span>
<blockquote>
<h4>Read Step by Step <a href="https://webappick.com/docs/woo-feed/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation</a> and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLapCcXJAoEenI-35wc6YnnsAAgoYRxDr7" rel="nofollow ugc">Video Tutorial</a></h4>

<p>
</p></blockquote>
<h3>WHY SHOULD YOU USE THIS WOOCOMMERCE PRODUCT FEED PLUGIN?</h3>
<p>CTX Feed is the best WooCommerce product feed plugin, and we proclaim it because we are the first pioneering plugin builder when it comes to creating a Product Feed for WooCommerce. We have been in the industry long enough to understand how WooCommerce feed works. That’s why we have introduced all the WordPress-Goers with our robust and revolutionary features that could facilitate your product uploading experience and get you rid of any trouble you face, such as uploading rejection or lack of necessary marketing channels’ attributes or inability to translate into a correct language or currency, etc.</p>
<p>Over the years of experience and expertise, we have curated all the factors that most online vendors face while creating the feed. You may not customize the product’s description or title properly. Also, the image links for the multiple variations of the same products may not function properly. Besides, making the feed in CSV format requires you to enter the data in the spreadsheet, resulting in a massive draining of your energy. If you need to create two feed files using CSV and XML format, the immediate transitions do not happen concurrently.</p>
<p>Here, our CTX Feed – WooCommerce Product Feed Plugin solves all the problems by giving you an ad-hoc solution. You can also format any attributes based on the output type that we have provided. We didn’t create those outputs by accident; we got them created from the feedback you all raised once encountering the issues. Hence, our tailored solutions can solve simple problems like formatting the price listing from two decimal to any decimals while giving the option to apply an integer. At the same time, this user-friendly plugin provides valuable identifiers add-on options to avoid any mismatch between the same brand’s products.</p>
<p>Let’s jump deeper into the ample features this mighty plugin has to offer:</p>
<h4>☞ UNLIMITED PRODUCTS</h4>
<p>No matter what the size of your inventory is, you can upload all of your products with no restriction imposed. From hundreds to thousands, you can upload unlimited products of your online store into any of the channels mentioned above, and that too with subtlety.</p>
<h4>☞ UNLIMITED FEED</h4>
<p>Like unlimited products uploading, you can make an infinite number of feeds containing any number of products of any sized store. You can access all the product feed files from the Manage Feeds option. To find the right feed out of a massive collection of feeds, you can look at the unique name of the feed instead of looking at the URL for your convenience.</p>
<h4>💯100+ PRE-CONFIGURED TEMPLATES 💯</h4>
<p>With our pre-configured 100+ built-in templates, you can make product feed within minutes without having to take excess pressure in researching every individual attribute or necessary field requirements of the known channels. It is time-consuming and bothersome to some extent. Besides, it is of no guarantee that your gleaned attributes will match precisely with the channels’ requirement, as some might change or some might turn from optional to compulsory.</p>
<p>Therefore, it is worth playing it safe to take advantage of our ready-made templates crafted extensively for the desired marketplaces.</p>
<h4>☞ SUPPORTS ANY PRODUCT FEED FILE TYPE</h4>
<p>This stellar WooCommerce product feed manager create the Product Feed for WooCommerce into 5 different feed file formats, the highest compared to any WooCommerce feed generator out there. The types are;</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>XML</strong> Product Feed</li>
<li><strong>CSV</strong> Product Feed</li>
<li><strong>TSV</strong> Product Feed</li>
<li><strong>XLS</strong> Product Feed</li>
<li><strong>TXT</strong> Product Feed</li>
<li><strong>JSON</strong> Product Feed</li>
</ul>
<p>These 5 types ensure that you create a product feed that appears differently yet uniquely to various marketing channels that they are destined to be promoting the products. They contain product information, including title, description, image URL, price, identifiers, and other attributes. Hence their appearance in the feed file entirely depends on how the channel wants to add them based on the type that you have selected. CTX Feed does them automatically once you select the type.</p>
<h4>☞ CREATE WOOCOMMERCE PRODUCT FEED USING USER-FRIENDLY INTERFACE</h4>
<p>The purpose of creating the feed is to carry out the information &amp; attributes of the products, which the designated channels can upload rightly and aptly. It allows the customers to find your products without missing any crucial information. Likewise, the marketing-based rejection rate drops significantly as the merchant meets all the requirements of that particular channel. The CTX Feed has all the elements rightly aligned on the same page to create or customize the right channels.</p>
<p>You don’t have to create any separate window to find, amend or modify any attributes or mandatory fields as all of them are in the same window. It makes your uploading process way easier without requiring any prior technical knowledge, making it less mistakable as you don’t have to hover in and out of the window too often.</p>
<h4>☞ SUPPORTS ANY WOOCOMMERCE PRODUCT TYPES</h4>
<p>We value your concern, and to reduce any unnecessary nuisances of finding the relevant products, CTX Feed enables your WooCommerce feed to fully incorporate by supporting all the plugins that help you provide options for Bundle products, composite products, mix and match products, and finally, subscription product. The reason being CTX Feed the best WooCommerce product feed plugin is because it supports some of the top-notch plugins like the following;</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/composite-products/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Composite Products</a>: This is a kit-builder plugin that is supported by CTX Feed, which allows the customers to customize or tweak their products from all the small accessories found on the product page to enhance the use of that specific product</li>
<li><a href="https://yithemes.com/themes/plugins/yith-woocommerce-composite-products/" rel="nofollow ugc">YITH Composite Products</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wpc-composite-products/" rel="ugc">WPC Composite Products for WooCommerce</a></li>
<li><a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/product-bundles/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Product Bundles</a>: When you create a deal containing some of the relevant products in bulk quantity together and give an offer on the whole deal, you need a plugin to support that personalized deal. CTX Feed readily endorses all of those plugins to create a Product Feed for WooCommerce in a perfect way.</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/yith-woocommerce-product-bundles/" rel="ugc">YITH WooCommerce Product Bundles</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/woo-product-bundle/" rel="ugc">WPC Product Bundles for WooCommerce</a></li>
<li><a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/woocommerce-subscriptions/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Subscription</a>: If you cover any subscription-based products, it will be easy for you to have a plugin that will give you an estimation of your residual revenue. Whatever money you make from the weekly, monthly, or annual subscription from the recurrent fees can be easily monitored using the WooCommerce Subscription plugin. CTX Feed boosts the outstanding experience by supporting the pertinent plugins needed for this effect to take place.</li>
</ul>
<h4>☞ VARIABLE AND VARIATION FEATURES ALL-INCLUSIVE</h4>
<p>Having multiple variable child products is no longer a hassle; you can now include any variations that a product might possess.</p>
<p><strong>Bear In Mind</strong> &#8211; with the help of <a href="https://webappick.com/plugin/woocommerce-product-feed-pro/" rel="nofollow ugc">CTX Feed Pro</a>  &#8211; you get six options where you can decide whether you wish to have all the products along with variations by selecting variable + variations or only variations by choosing all variations. You can also decide if you wish to go for parent product only or just any specific variant. Just set the instruction, and our WooCommerce-WP product feed manager will automatically include or exclude the variable and variations.</p>
<h4>☞ CREATING CUSTOM TEMPLATES FOR ANY CHANNELS</h4>
<p>This free version allows you to make any template for your personalized marketplace. If you intend to create a template for a more complex XML feed file, that is possible too. Using Custom Template 2 a premium feature of CTX Feed Pro, the developers can easily play around with the coding system to make any attributes you need for your channels. Also, if you want us to focus on your marketing channels and include its template in our CTX Feed plugin, you are requested to send your feed requirements to the <a href="https://webappick.com/contact/" rel="nofollow ugc">CTX Feed Support Team</a>.</p>
<h4>☞ PRODUCT ATTRIBUTES:</h4>
<p>Attributes are the mainstay of the product feed. The purpose to create a product feed for WooCommerce is to get as much information as possible regarding the inventory products. Based on that, your products will be highlighted on your preferred marketplace.</p>
<p>CTX Feed – a powerful WooCommerce product feed plugin, that helps you create any attributes into any channels alongside the pre-configured attributes. These attributes can range from product ID, Title, Description, Image link, Brand, Price, MPN to Tax, Shipping, Gender, Height, Material, Availability, Stock Availability, Size, Delivery Cost, and many more. You can either avail them directly from the drop-down menu or make your bespoke one.</p>
<h4>☞ USE OUTPUT TYPES TO AVOID ANY ERRORS</h4>
<p>Output types are the one that makes this plugin the best plugin to create Product Feed for WooCommerce. When you create a Product Feed for WooCommerce, it is most likely that mistakes continue without your acknowledgment. Remember, not all your merchants require all of the information, such as when it comes to adding HTML tags, manipulation of shortcodes, or wrong exploitation of the numbering format.</p>
<p>To use them correctly in your attributes, the use of correct output is a prerequisite. You have an option to change or apply any output types for any given attributes for any channels. We have over 20 output types, and take a look at how it works;</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Strip Tags</strong>: If you any HTML code like <code>&lt;p&gt;string &lt;/p&gt;</code> in any attributes, strip tag will remove it and leave it as only String</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Remove Special Characters</strong>: Using this, you can get rid of any unnecessary non-UTF-8 characters of product description derived from any source when copied.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>CDATA</strong>: Your XML feed file will show up as an error if there is a contradiction between the XML element and only element. It generally happens when the words of the XML attributes, such as Title, Description, etc., match exactly with the main words in the description, title, or other attributes’ boxes.<br />
This plugin can remove this issue when applied CDATA as it sets the code into every attribute like the following   </p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Remove Shortcodes</strong>: Shortcodes are the small codes that take to you the page where you have added any specific elements, such as slides, images, tables, etc. Having them in the description or title can cause trouble when they are made using different plugins; it can be possible that you no longer have those plugins. Also, you may not want to see an image’s shortcode in the description when you already have a link to that image.<br />
Therefore, Remove Shortcodes will remove that particular code from those sections, freeing you from any hassles.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Price</strong>: Your pricing format is essential, especially if it is still not tweaked. If you use the price format on WooCommerce, which doesn’t fit into the standard format, don’t worry! The CTX Feed’s default pricing mode will apply to your price. Still, you can customize your pricing format using our plugin.<br />
Remove Space: If you accidentally put double space between any words or texts, or characters, you can remove them in any attributes using Remove Space.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Parent</strong>: If the product has variations, then the main product is called the variable, and the child products are called the variations. In this instance, if the information like the description of the variable is not empty, then the variable (parent) is given more priority and adds the description of that parent. Whereas the variations (child products) value will be selected when the variable description is empty</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Parent_if_empty</strong>: It means, when the variations information, such as description, is empty, it will only add the value of the parent (variable)<br />
Google Date Format: You can easily set your date as per Google’s required Merchant required format like [Date and time, ISO 8601 compliant (YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss, or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss Z)].</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>If you want to know more about how the output type and other bits work, check out our <a href="https://webappick.com/docs/ctx-feed/basic/make-woocommerce-product-feed/" rel="nofollow ugc">documentation</a> on CTX Feed.</p>
<h4>☞ PREFIX &amp; SUFFIX:</h4>
<p>Both prefix and suffix are a series of letter, or more precisely, characters that describe the pattern of the Value of the attributes within the Product Feed for WooCommerce. Prefix sits just before the value, whereas the suffix sits after the value. One such example is the currency code, which is an important factor in deciding whether the plugin used to generate it is the best WooCommerce product feed plugin. You can use the currency symbol such as £ or $ as a prefix before the amount (the value) or the USD or GBP as a suffix right after the amount.</p>
<h4>☞ STATIC VALUE:</h4>
<p>This is one of the most distinctive features that CTX Feed users can take advantage of when dealing with an enormous number of products. You get to choose whether you wish to apply the same value for all the products in the Merchant center or individual value. Attribute and pattern are the two types; the Attribute denotes the individual value for all the products, and the Static implies the same value for all.</p>
<p>For instance, if you have hundreds of products that refer to the same brand, in that case, you will choose a Pattern type that will decide the same value for all of them. However, in the case of a unique identifier like SKU, you will choose the Attribute type as the SKU is unique for each product.</p>
<h4>☞ CATEGORY MAPPING:</h4>
<p>Categories are the essential key to get products into search results. It is best practice to assign the most matching shopping engine category to your WooCommerce store category for each product. During the creation of your WooCommerce product feeds, you can also create a category for that particular product. And after creating the category, you’ll get an option to map it to your marketplace category so that you can make two categories aligned to each other. This feature is mostly used for Google Shopping feed and Facebook/Instagram product feed. The process is dynamic by our plugin &amp; you can map all of your categories to make them more relevant &amp; reachable to buyers.</p>
<p>One of the most critical factors of promoting and selling your products through various merchant centers is to get the right search for the Google product category. Your inventory products must have the correct category so that customers can find them easily and relate them to their daily needs. Remember, the Google product category you select for your WooCommerce products may not match your desired marketing channels. You will have to come up with the right category. The CTX Feed gives you that opportunity to create your individual products categories that are in keeping with the channels’ categories. This feature is mostly used for Google Shopping product feed, Facebook Catalog feed, Pinterest Catalog feed, and others who follow Google Shopping Feed Structure.</p>
<p>Once you are done with the category-creating of your WooCommerce product in the Category Mapping, you can then navigate the initial categories to the newly created categories. It makes the customers’ searching easier, and your product gets more discoverable on the search engines.</p>
<h4>☞ BATCH FEED MAKING:</h4>
<p>Due to PHP execution time and memory limit, it&#8217;s not possible to process Thousands of products at a time. We have developed the CTX feed plugin with the functionality to make feed with batches. Users can easily set Limit and Offset to make feed. This functionality is compatible with any WordPress Hosting and any number of products you have on your site.</p>
<p>If you own a larger inventory with lots of products, it is not always possible to process all of them simultaneously; it can be deemed an error due to lower PHP execution time, memory limit, and poor server/hosting configuration. If the PHP script time runs out of the designated time, the script stops and gives the error. Therefore, our WooCommerce product feed manager helps you to create product feed with the largest inventory in small batches so that you never get stuck.</p>
<p>You can also set the batch limit by which your products will be listed in the feed. Hence, no chance of error or rejection. This specific feature of the CTX Feed is compatible with all kinds of WordPress hosting for any size of products your inventory contains.</p>
<h4>☞ WP OPTIONS:</h4>
<p>The significant bit of this plugin is that it allows you to include any wp-options values into your feed file. For any attribute, you can add these values. The wp-options values can not only be added from your own CTX Feed plugin, but also you can add the values generated by the other essential plugins that you use for your online store purpose since those values are stored as options. It simply means that you can use the values in your feed file generated from both our WooCommerce product feed manager as well as the other generators too.</p>
<h4>☞ AUTO FEED UPDATE:</h4>
<p>This WooCommerce product feed plugin automatically updates your products based on your given interval time, saving you from manually updating it by logging in and checking. The free version gives you 5 intervals, whereas the Product Feed Pro for WooCommerce gives you three shorter intervals for quicker feed updates.</p>
<p>As stated before, this plugin processes Product Feed for WooCommerce in batches to get away with any feed rejection rate due to a vast number of products as the auto-update could have failed. However, suppose your PHP time limit, hosting, and server configuration turns out poor. In that case, this plugin may not be able to complete the operation if the inventory contains thousands of products at a time. Usually, the auto-update updates all the products at the same time; otherwise, it will cause an error in feed uploading. In that case, you need to upgrade your PHP execution time within the server.</p>
<h4>☞ GOOGLE PRODUCT FEED:</h4>
<p>Creating product feed for Google Shopping has become twice as easy as ever before. Out of 100+ pre-configured templates, the Google Shopping Product Feed template is one of the most tangible templates, rolling out all the essential attributes that you need to complete the feed creation with the help of this CTX Feed plugin. Neither do you need to scroll Google or other web content to find out the required fields, nor will you have to go through the detailed Google guideline to check which pattern they expect you to follow to make a successful Google Shopping feed? CTX Feed contains all the mandatory fields, such as MPN, GTIN, Brand, Condition, Gender, etc.</p>
<p>In fact, CTX Feed automatically recognizes the value that needs to be set for those required fields for the Google Shopping Product feed. This is the best WooCommerce Google Shopping plugin to create product feed abides by the <a href="https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/7052112?hl=en" rel="nofollow ugc">Google product feed specification</a>. And you can see the exact reflection of the format already set as default in all the attributes within the Google Shopping Feed template. Therefore, no manually setting up; use it like plug and play. Select it and choose the correct output value in the feed.</p>
<h4>☞ MULTILINGUAL GOOGLE SHOPPING PRODUCT FEED</h4>
<p>In the process of globalization, language is no longer a barrier. Creating a Google Product Feed for WooCommerce for every country doesn’t require you to change the language from default to multiple languages manually. The best WooCommerce product feed for Google Shopping plugin – CTX Feed Pro comes with the multi-lingual feature, making a swift transition from the default language (where the original store is originally based) of one country to another language for the new country of sale with the help of supplementary Google Shopping feed. And that too happens without making any changes in the currency as the currency changes automatically on Google Merchant Center.</p>
<h4>☞ GOOGLE CANONICAL URL:</h4>
<p>Google often suffers from the canonical issue when the main product page has multiple variant pages. Multiple variants occur when the main product has specific variants, like sizes, colors, etc. This makes Google confused as to which page it should focus more on. This is where Google Shopping <a href="https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/9340054?hl=en" rel="nofollow ugc">canonical_link</a> comes in handy, and thereby you can go to the main product’s landing page and put the URL of the main page into all the variants’’ pages so that Google redirects the users of those variant pages to the main landing page, which contains no pre-selected parameters.</p>
<h4>☞ GOOGLE SHIPPING &amp; TAX:</h4>
<p>CTX Feed is a perfect WooCommerce Google Product Feed Manager with perfect integration of Google Shipping and Tax. It draws the information, such as shipping zone, class, region, postcode, shipping methods (flat rate, free shipping, local pickup) from the WooCommerce shipping setting and maps them into the newly created Google Product feed to reflect the accurate shipping alignment to your products. Whatever information you customize into your WooCommerce setting will be adjusted automatically the moment you map the two settings into the correct attribute within the feed.</p>
<p>Besides, our Google Shopping product feed generator also supports the <a href="https://codecanyon.net/item/table-rate-shipping-for-woocommerce/3796656" rel="nofollow ugc">Table Rate Shipping</a> plugin by BolderElement, which helps you to apply conditions on shipping based on their classes, individuality, delivery time, etc. The plugin also supports <a href="https://codecanyon.net/item/woocommerce-advanced-shipping/8634573" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Advanced Shipping</a> plugin by Sormano.</p>
<h4>☞ GOOGLE ANALYTICS UTM PARAMETER:</h4>
<p>WooCommerce Product Feed plugin has an option to include Google Analytics UTM parameters to the product URLs that will help you evaluate your marketing channels&#8217; performance via Google Analytics.</p>
<h4>☞ GOOGLE DYNAMIC REMARKETING:</h4>
<p>Google Dynamic remarketing event snippet collects data about specific searches related to a product and represents personalized ads by matching them with your product feed.</p>
<p>Our plugin allows you to add Google Dynamic Remarketing event snippets across different pages of your website and enable the basic remarketing features of Google Remarketing Tracking.</p>
<h3>☞ TABLE RATE SHIPPING:</h3>
<p>For the optimum usage of WooCommerce shipping, this WooCommerce Google Shopping feed manager is compatible with WooCommerce Bolder Element’s Table rate shipping and Woocommerce Advanced Shipping plugin by sormano.</p>
<h3>☞ FACEBOOK CATALOG  FEED/ INSTAGRAM SHOPPING FEED:</h3>
<p>Like the WooCommerce product feed for Google Shopping, Facebook and Instagram have their unique product attributes based on their own guidelines. They will differ from the other reputable marketing channels. By using their required attributes, you can facilitate the WooCommerce Facebook product feed catalog, which, in turn, will increase the visibility of your Facebook shop for WooCommerce. The more optimized your WooCommerce Facebook Product Feed Catalog is, the more your products match the relevant keywords searched by the customers. The same applies to the Instagram shop WooCommerce plugin.</p>
<p>When you create a Product Feed using Facebook and Instagram Shop WooCommerce plugin, you may get attributes for any marketplace, including Facebook and Instagram, but that won’t be sufficient enough to support your catalog, as you don’t remain updated all the time regarding which attributes are added recently and which are discarded. By using CTX Feed, you will populate the attributes as per Facebook/Instagram’s requirements.</p>

You can keep a record of your online visitors, as well as the ad-campaigns progress.</p>

Since Facebook is accessed worldwide, promoting your product through Facebook is undoubtedly a super platform. But people may face difficulty when your product’s title, description, or currency appear as the default language, same as the store&#8217;s origin. Yet this CTX Feed Pro – WooCommerce Product Feed Pro Plugin helps you create the <a href="https://www.facebook.com/business/help/2144286692311411?id=725943027795860" rel="nofollow ugc">Facebook country/language override feed</a>for any language you configured in your site.</p>

<h4>If you like Free Version, you&#8217;ll love the Pro Version</h4>
<p></p>
<h4><a href="http://webappick.com/plugin/woocommerce-product-feed-pro/" rel="nofollow ugc">CTX Feed Pro &#8211; WooCommerce Product Feed Plugin</a> gives you everything you&#8217;ll find in free and some awesome features described below.</h4>

<h3>☞ PRODUCT BRAND (PRO FEATURE)</h3>
<p>When you focus on your products’ branding, people find it more beneficial as they develop more trust in your online store. When people search for a product, the first thing they will notice is the brand they are purchasing. The brand items, such as their name, logo, copyright, will retain the customers on your product page longer. Therefore, the ability to have the attribute options to include the brand of the product is a must. CTX Feed has the brand option to let you create the brand of your products and use them in your WooCommerce Product Feed Pro plugin.</p>
<p>Besides, this premium WooCommerce-WP product feed manager helps you extract the other brands generated by other branding plugins to use in your feed. Those plugins are used to create a new brand, logos, etc. They also allow you to use A-Z shortcodes to give you the option to list your various brands so that the brands can be found and navigated easily. Some of these supported plugins are;</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/brands/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce Brands</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/perfect-woocommerce-brands/" rel="ugc">Perfect Brands for WooCommerce</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/yith-woocommerce-brands-add-on/" rel="ugc">YITH WooCommerce Brands Add-On</a></li>
<li><a href="https://codecanyon.net/item/ultimate-woocommerce-brands-plugin/9433984" rel="nofollow ugc">Ultimate WooCommerce Brands Plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>💎DYNAMIC ATTRIBUTE (PRO FEATURE) 💎</h4>
<p>If there is one of the reasons why CTX Feed is the best WooCommerce product data feed plugin, Dynamic attribute complements it. With this pro feature, you can set a series of conditions on each attribute regardless of any marketing channels. These conditions ensure that the products will meet the conditions based on their selected attributes, and based on that, they or their relevant information will appear. For example, if you want certain products’ height &gt; 2cm ‘to appear as “big,” and the rest of them with height &lt; 2cm to be “small,” it can be done by dynamic attribute feature. This will help you to meet any channel requirements.</p>
<h4>💎SMART FILTER &amp; CONDITION (PRO FEATURE) 💎</h4>
<p>Smart &amp; Advanced features are two of the most remarkable features of CTX Feed Pro. Both features can include or remove the products based on your instructions. If you want specific products, such as products with backorder, out-of-stock, or empty description products to be out of the Product Feed for WooCommerce, you can easily tick them within this plugin Product Feed Pro for WooCommerce in the Smart Filtering option. You can also include the products that are either loss-making or have lower demand.</p>
<p>Besides, Advanced Filtering allows you to put certain conditions on the products based on their various attributes like title, id, description, height, length, weight, price, price with tax, availability, etc., depending on the conditions. The product feed will either include all of the conditions or only any of the fulfilled conditions.</p>
<h4>💎ATTRIBUTE MAPPING (PRO FEATURE) 💎</h4>
<p>First impressions are the most lasting. The title is the one that customers fancy first. In most cases, the e-commerce owners hardly prioritize the title, but this is where your competitors are more likely to take advantage of. Good titles will pursue to click on that product and switch straight to that product’s main online site. The customers get an in-depth insight into what that product is all about. If the title is short or too ambiguous, it will increase the bounce rate, leading the customers to refrain from it. Therefore, CTX Feed Pro has the built-in attribute mapping feature so that it lets you extend the title or any attributes to force the customers to click and yet purchase your products.</p>
<p>For example, if your title has the brand name, product name, user’s gender, usage purpose, seasons, etc., it is more likely to turn your customers into conversions. This feature is crucial for generating WooCommerce product feed for Google Shopping and Facebook shop WooCommerce as this may help the customers distinguish between the same products within Google or Facebook Shopping.</p>
<h4>💥MULTI-LANGUAGE FEED &#8211; WPML &amp; POLYLANG (PRO FEATURE) 💥</h4>
<p>WooCommerce Product Feed Pro is compatible with  &amp; plugin for Multi-Language Feed. And by supporting WPML &amp; Polylang makes it possible for the WooCommerce store owners to create WooCommerce product feed in different languages &amp; currencies.</p>
<p>Multilanguage enables retailers to globalize their business in minutes because they always have a better chance of selling something if they are already selling it in the native language.</p>
<p>When you think broader and wish to popularize your products worldwide, you can’t think of confining your products only to the local market, where the language is the same as the online store’s location. To reach out to a massive number of people in every corner of the world, your plugin Product Feed Pro for WooCommerce has to have the ability to translate the language into the convenient language of that particular region’s people. The more they can understand and read your product’s detail, the better it will perform internationally. Supported Multi-language plugin are:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wpml.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">WPML</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/polylang/" rel="ugc">Polylang</a></li>
<li><a href="https://translatepress.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">TranslatePress</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>💥MULTI-CURRENCY FEED (PRO FEATURE) 💥</h4>
<p>When you want to globalize the business by selling your products in different local channels of different countries, you can create the product feed with the currency according to that channel’s currency requirement.</p>
<p>WooCommerce Product Feed Pro can create product feeds for specific currencies.</p>

<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-currency-switcher/" rel="ugc">WooCommerce Currency Switcher (WOOCS)</a> by realmag777.</li>
</ul>
<h4>💥MULTI-VENDOR FEED (PRO FEATURE) 💥</h4>
<p>By using some of the high-grade multi-vendor plugins, you can generate feeds for single or multi-vendors. This WooCommerce product feed manager allows you to have multiple vendors promoting their products under your own website. In that case, you can assign the products to individual vendors based on their preferences and generate the product feeds according to their list of products enlisted on WooCommerce shopping. Currently, CTX Feed Pro supports the following multi-vendor plugins, such as</p>
<ul>
